title: Music
description: Zu, a free spirit estranged from her family, suddenly finds herself the sole guardian of her half-sister, Music, a teenager on the autism spectrum whose whole world order has been beautifully crafted by her late grandmother. The film soon challenges whether it is Zu or Music who has a better view of the world, and that love, trust, and being able to be there for each other is everything.

reviews.text: Worse than problematic. Imagine every downside of surrounding yourself with sycophants who love the smell of your farts and refuse to say "no" to you as a creator. Now, play all of these downsides out to their extent and you get "Music," a film that's not only hopelessly empty and trite, but apt to cause real-life harm. Like, demonstrably. I won't even get into the controversies at hand because they're honestly infuriating, with implications that can get dark pretty fast, so I'll just leave you all with this; there's a scene in here where Sia appears as a fictionalized version of herself, promoting a practice involving her smuggling medicine to third-world countries. I owe you an apology, M. Night Shyamalan in "Lady In The Water" - THIS is the most self-absorbed **** I've ever seen. With music-video-like breaks in narrativity that make absolutely no sense and some profoundly cringe-worthy dialogue, "Music" has to be one of the most tone-deaf attempts at handling a concept with such sensitive subject matter that I've ever seen in the big leagues.

Extremely offensive, problematic, and grotesque are some of the words I'd use to describe Miss Sia's twisted fantasy. Can't believe trash like this is still being produced in 2021, but I guess you live long enough and you get to see everything.

Disfrute la película, te rompe el corazón para después romperlo y volverlo a reparar.La película suscita polémica por un lado por la elección de la actriz Maddie Ziegler, que interpreta a una joven con autismo sin verse afectada ella misma, y ​​por otro lado por estar teñida de muchos estereotipos sobre el autismo.  La representación del autismo se considera inexacta y peligrosa debido, en parte, a una escena en la que se realiza una técnica de restricción en MUSIC(personaje). Todas estas críticas ponen en tela de juicio el libre albedrío de la directora, que sin embargo debería tener plena libertad de elección de sus actores o actores, y del contenido de las escenas de su propia película.La cantante/directora Sia se disculpo y ahora da solución a los conflictos que pudo causar su película. Como acertadamente apunta la directora, su película "no es un documental sino una ficción".   Es buena la iniciativa, su idea de no hacer una generalización de los autistas sino de ilustrar a los llamados autistas no verbales.

Sia's Music is a wonderful and heartwarming movie! The issues that a young child experiences through a big case of autism are described and displayed very well! This is enhanced by the metaphors shown in the perfectly timed and well executed in-between music videoclips that play during important plot points. Not only are some of those clips colorful and playful, but they also are great as separate pop singles.    To further add to this, drug addiction, alcoholism, family problems, bullying and psychological issues are also being mentioned and incorporated in a realistic way to also heighten the film's awareness messages that is providing. A realistic story with its ups and downs is being told that can happen in any neighborhood nowadays.    I wanted to also touch the controversy that has been going around this film regarding a non-autistic person playing an autistic one (Maddie). To my mind her performance was great and passionate! Working with Sia all these years, she was perfect and already experienced for the dance routines performed in the in-between music clips. In addition, you could see the pain that a girl with such a problem can have in a somewhat of an extreme case. These extreme cases are plentiful in the real world. People and their families suffer from trying to cope and cooperate taking care of such children. Keep in mind that they are some of the most love educing children/people that you can find, despite having such a disorder!    I know there are autistic actors that could have been casted for this. In the role of this specific case of somewhat of an extreme autistic disorder it would have been a difficult time for the child itself. Imagine bringing to the film such a case of an autistic child. That child could have reacted in the painful way on-screen that could affect her mentally for some of the subjects raised in the film in the future. These children need special treatment constantly (as the film itself shows) and some of them are not given that! This film raises some awareness for this and hopefully it will touch a lot of people.In summary:+ Great and realistic story with its cheerful and sad moments+ Excellent acting from all three main actors! Maddie, Kate and Leslie+ Catchy and colorful pop songs+ Nice work from the supporting cast+ May raise some awareness about a lot of issues in our societyI am giving this film a 10/10 based on my overall review and since it's one of the few cases that these issues are raised in such a magical and musical way!
